static final int TITLE
The Title component of this view. Currently, this value is used only by graphs.

Constant Field Values

RESET_NONE

static final int RESET_NONE
Reset no default property values or listeners and callbacks before applying XML. Not a valid constant for the resetToDefault method.

See Also:
#resetToDefault(int), #readXML, #setXML, Constant Field Values

RESET_XML_PROPERTIES

static final int RESET_XML_PROPERTIES
Reset properties to their defaults. Resets properties to the defaults, but does not remove any registered listeners and callbacks.

See Also:
#resetToDefault(int), #readXML, #setXML, Constant Field Values

RESET_EVERYTHING

static final int RESET_EVERYTHING
Reset everything, to make the Dataview as if it were newly created. Resets all properties to their default settings, and removes any registered listeners and callbacks. Used mostly with the resetToDefault method.

See Also:
#resetToDefault(int), Constant Field Values

RESET_XML_PROPERTIES_ORIGINAL

static final int RESET_XML_PROPERTIES_ORIGINAL
See Also:
Constant Field Values

RESET_EVERYTHING_ORIGINAL

static final int RESET_EVERYTHING_ORIGINAL
See Also:
Constant Field Values

RESET_XML_PROPERTIES_CUSTOM

static final int RESET_XML_PROPERTIES_CUSTOM
See Also:
oracle.dss.gridView.GridView#applyCSSStyleDefaults, Constant Field Values

RESET_EVERYTHING_CUSTOM

static final int RESET_EVERYTHING_CUSTOM
See Also:
oracle.dss.gridView.GridView#applyCSSStyleDefaults, Constant Field Values

RESET_EVERYTHING_NOT_DATASOURCE

static final int RESET_EVERYTHING_NOT_DATASOURCE
Resets everything except for the current DataSource. Resets all properties to their default settings, removes any registered listeners and callbacks, but leaves the current DataSource intact. Used mostly with the resetToDefault method.

See Also:
#resetToDefault(int), Constant Field Values

RESET_MAX

static final int RESET_MAX
See Also:
Constant Field Values

MAP_DATA

static final int MAP_DATA
All of the data points in the plot area of a dataview. When you use this constant in the getImagemapEnumeration method and writeImagemapXML method, you get a report of the data points that are currently present and visible in the dataview.

See Also:
#getImagemapEnumeration, #writeImagemapXML, Constant Field Values

MAP_LEGEND

static final int MAP_LEGEND
The legend text and legend markers of the graph. When you use this constant in the getImagemapEnumeration method and writeImagemapXML method, you get a report of the legend text and legend markers that are currently present and visible in the graph.

See Also:
#getImagemapEnumeration, #writeImagemapXML, Constant Field Values

MAP_DATATEXT

static final int MAP_DATATEXT
The data text, pie slice labels and pie labels of the graph. When you use this constant in the getImagemapEnumeration method and writeImagemapXML method, you get a report of the data text, pie slice labels and pie labels that are currently present and visible in the graph.

See Also:
#getImagemapEnumeration, #writeImagemapXML, Constant Field Values

MAP_ORDINALLABELS

static final int MAP_ORDINALLABELS
The labels for the ordinal axis of the graph. When you use this constant in the getImagemapEnumeration method and writeImagemapXML method, you get a report of the ordinal axis tick labels that are currently present and visible in the graph.

See Also:
#getImagemapEnumeration, #writeImagemapXML, Constant Field Values

MAP_LABELS

static final int MAP_LABELS
The tick labels for the data axes of the dataview. When you use this constant in the getImagemapEnumeration method and writeImagemapXML method, you get a report of the data-axis tick labels that are currently present and visible in the dataview.

See Also:
#getImagemapEnumeration, #writeImagemapXML, Constant Field Values

MAP_TITLES

static final int MAP_TITLES
The title, subtitle, footnote, and either axis titles (graph) or top,bottom,metric labels (gauge) of the dataview. When you use this constant in the getImagemapEnumeration and writeImagemapXML methods, you will get a report of the title components of the dataview that are currently present and visible.

See Also:
#getImagemapEnumeration, #writeImagemapXML, Constant Field Values

MAP_ALL

static final int MAP_ALL
All of the image map components that are supported by a dataview. When you use this constant in the getImagemapEnumeration method and writeImagemapXML method, you get a report of the tick labels for the data axes, tick labels for the ordinal axis (for graph), title, subtitle, footnote, axis titles (for graph), legend text and legend markers (for graph), data text, presently visible pie slice labels and pie labels (for graph), and top, bottom, and metric labels (for gauge).

writeImagemapXML(MAP_ALL) is equivalent to writeImagemapXML(MAP_DATA|MAP_LEGEND|MAP_DATATEXT| MAP_ORDINALLABELS|MAP_LABELS|MAP_TITLES).

See Also:
#getImagemapEnumeration, #writeImagemapXML, Constant Field Values

LAP_TOP

static final int LAP_TOP
Legend area position: Top. The legend appears above the plot area.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LAP_BOTTOM

static final int LAP_BOTTOM
Legend area position: Bottom. The legend appears below the plot area.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LAP_RIGHT

static final int LAP_RIGHT
Legend area position: Right. The legend appears to the right of the plot area.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LAP_LEFT

static final int LAP_LEFT
Legend area position: Left. The legend appears to the left of the plot area.

See Also:

GD_RIGHT

static final int GD_RIGHT
Gradient direction: Right. The color begins on the left and fades to the right.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GD_DOWN

static final int GD_DOWN
Gradient direction: Down. The color begins at the top and fades downward.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GD_DIAGONAL_45

static final int GD_DIAGONAL_45
Gradient direction: Diagonal, 45-degree angle. The color begins at the upper right and fades to the lower left.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GD_DIAGONAL_135

static final int GD_DIAGONAL_135
Gradient direction: Diagonal, 135-degree angle. The color begins at the upper left and fades to the lower right.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GD_RADIAL

static final int GD_RADIAL
Gradient direction: Radial. The color begins in the center of the fill area and fades into the outside. Note that this gradient direction cannot be reversed.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GD_RADIAL_TOP_LEFT

static final int GD_RADIAL_TOP_LEFT
Gradient direction: Radial top left. The color begins in the outer-most part of the fill area and fades into a point in the upper left corner.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GD_RADIAL_TOP_RIGHT

static final int GD_RADIAL_TOP_RIGHT
Gradient direction: Radial top right. The color begins in the outer-most part of the fill area and fades into a point in the upper left corner.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GD_RADIAL_BOTTOM_LEFT

static final int GD_RADIAL_BOTTOM_LEFT
Gradient direction: Radial bottom left. The color begins in the outer-most part of the fill area and fades into a point in the lower left corner.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GD_RADIAL_BOTTOM_RIGHT

static final int GD_RADIAL_BOTTOM_RIGHT
Gradient direction: Radial bottom right. The color begins in the outer-most part of the fill area and fades into a point in the lower right corner.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GD_RADIAL_OFF_CENTER

static final int GD_RADIAL_OFF_CENTER
Gradient direction: Radial off center. The color begins in the top left region of the fill area and fades into a point in the lower right corner.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GD_CUSTOM_LINEAR

static final int GD_CUSTOM_LINEAR
Gradient direction: Custom. The direction is determined by the startPoint and endPoint of the gradient. This is for internal use only.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GD_CUSTOM_RADIAL

static final int GD_CUSTOM_RADIAL
Gradient direction: Custom. This is for internal use only.

See Also:
